channel.title: [News] A new Canadian tool can re-grow teeth!
channel.description:
[center][b]A new Canadian tool can re-grow teeth![/b][/center] Amazing. Canadians are really getting good. Canadians stocks are rising, 36 Canadian Theators are goign to get nominated for a prize, and captured many terrorists. Well anyways back to the article. Yes the canadian tool can re-grow teeth! In the article, it said that it should be ideal for hockey players and sugar lovers. A partial quote from the article on how it works:
Chen helped create the tiny ultrasound machine that gently massages gums and stimulates tooth growth from the root once inserted into a person's mouth, mounted on braces or a removable plastic crown. The wireless device, smaller than a pea, must be activated for 20 minutes each day for four months to stimulate growth, he said. It can also stimulate jawbone growth to fix a person's crooked smile and may eventually allow people to grow taller by stimulating bone growth, Chen said.
Yay! No more crooked smiles or small teeth with relaxed gums from all those massages... sounds good. :D Source: http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20060628/wl_canada_afp/canadaussciencehealth ~Ron

item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Probably a lot of money. Just like when they found the gene for aging and said they could sell it for about $1000 a bottle once it’s made. That’s bullshit, maybe this is too. I read on a different article at NYTimes.com and it said something like $200 for a bag of those peas.

[center]A new Canadian tool can re-grow teeth![/center]

Amazing. Canadians are really getting good. Canadians stocks are rising, 36 Canadian Theators are goign to get nominated for a prize, and captured many terrorists. Well anyways back to the article.

Yes the canadian tool can re-grow teeth! In the article, it said that it should be ideal for hockey players and sugar lovers.

A partial quote from the article on how it works:

Chen helped create the tiny ultrasound machine that gently massages gums and stimulates tooth growth from the root once inserted into a person's mouth, mounted on braces or a removable plastic crown.

The wireless device, smaller than a pea, must be activated for 20 minutes each day for four months to stimulate growth, he said.

It can also stimulate jawbone growth to fix a person’s crooked smile and may eventually allow people to grow taller by stimulating bone growth, Chen said.

Yay! No more crooked smiles or small teeth with relaxed gums from all those massages… sounds good.
